caller_intent: Emma wanted to change a client's payment plan to an 11-pay option but later agreed to switch to a 12-pay plan after discussing the required upfront payment and billing timelines.
resolution_steps: Amani explained the $680.04 payment required to switch to the 11-pay plan and clarified the 20-day billing window rule.
Emma requested deferring the payment to next month but was informed this wasn't possible under the 11-pay terms.
Emma opted to switch to the 12-pay plan instead, which doesn't require an upfront payment.
Amani confirmed the change would be processed and take effect within 24 hours.
knowledge_required: Understanding of different payment plan structures (11-pay vs. 12-pay) and their financial requirements
Billing cycle rules (e.g., 20-day window for payment changes)
Internal systems for processing payment plan changes
summary: A call between an Alliance Insurance agent (Amani) and Penn National representative (Emma) resolved a payment plan change request. After discussing the financial requirements and timelines for an 11-pay plan, the client opted for a 12-pay plan instead, which was processed with expected 24-hour effectiveness. The conversation highlighted specific billing rules and payment plan terms.
